sen.j: 鎌倉幕府には正史的な歴史書『吾妻鏡』があり、江戸幕府には同様の意味を持つ『徳川実紀』があったが、室町幕府は政情不安が長期にわたって続いたためにまとまった歴史書が編纂される機会がなかった。
sen.e: For the Kamakura bakufu, there is official history-like history book Azuma Kagami (a chronicle of the history of the Kamakura bakufu) and, for the Edo bakufu, there is similar history book "Tokugawa Jikki", but, for the Muromachi bakufu, there was no opportunity to compile a reliable history book because political instability continued for a long period.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府以来の正統な武家政権であると自負する江戸幕府は両武家政権をつなぐ存在である室町幕府の正史を補うとともに当時台頭してきた尊王論に対抗して武家政権の正統性を強調する目的で同書を編纂させたのである。
sen.e: The Edo bakufu, which was self-confident to be the legitimate samurai government since the Kamakura bakufu caused it compiles in order to supplement the official history ot the Muromachi bakufu which existed as a link between two bakufu and to emphasize the legitimacy of the samurai governments to cope with the imperialism that had been gaining power.

The Edo bakufu was confident in being the legitimate samurai government since the Kamakura bakufu brought forth the need for such a compilation in order to supplement the official history of the Muromachi bakufu, which existed as a link between two bakufu, and to emphasize the legitimacy of the samurai governments in coping with the imperialism that had become more prevalent.

Proud of being the legitimate samurai government descended from the Kamakura bakufu, the Edo bakufu commissioned the text in order to supplement the official history of the Muromachi bakufu, which formed a kind of link between the Edo and Kamakura bakufu, as well as to reinforce the legitimacy of samurai government in an attempt to stem the rising tide of imperialism.
